results.title: 11 Steps to Survival
results.creator_credit: Pierre L'Amare, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film demonstrating steps to take in the event of a nuclear attack. Animated drawings show the effects of atomic explosions in the air and at ground level. How wide an area is affected by light and heat flash, radiation and radio-active fall-out is clearly illustrated. How to build or improvise a fall-out shelter, what to stock in it, when to take shelter and how long to stay there are similarly explained.

results.title: [Melbourne newsreel: 1925]
results.brief_description: A newsreel of Melbourne in 1925 containing scenes of Empire Day celebrations at Princes Hill State School, Carlton; the opening of the Melbourne Track Season; a three-mile handicap race at Caulfield Racecourse by the Combined Harriers; and long-distance running. Re-released in 1947 by the National Film Archive.

results.title: Cave temples of India
results.creator_credit: Jagat Murari, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: A vivid reminder of a great past when people created miracles in stone to express devotion to their gods. Shows some of the famous rock-cut shrines, including the caves at Badami, Elephanta and Ellora, dating from the 17th century. Explains the statues depicting the various incarnations of the Hindu deity. Commentary by Berkeley Hill.

results.title: Special Project no. 14: Marlo-Mallacoota-Cape Conran
results.brief_description: The Country Roads Board’s Project no. 14 involves the building of a road from Orbost to Marlo. Shows the first section to Cape Conran and difficulties encountered in clearing and leveling the sandy loam. The area opened by the road has great development potential in its attractive surf beaches, bushland and off-shore oil drilling. Photography by Jim Stirling.

results.title: Spectacle Talks: Gotye and his Collaborators
results.creator_credit: Gotye, Mike Kenneally, Shelley Matulick, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Multi award-winning musician, songwriter and producer Gotye is no stranger to collaboration. His music videos are a testament to this, utilising the talents of diverse directors, artists and animators. Often involving a range of complex animation and filmmaking techniques, visual worlds are created floating seamlessly against his music.
Natasha Pincus, Andrew Goldsmith, and directors of Rubber House animation studio Ivan Dixon and Greg Sharp disscus a selection of Gotye’s most renowned videos. These include ‘Easy Way Out’, ‘Seven Hours With A Back Seat Driver’, ‘State Of The Art’ and the international chart-topping ‘Somebody That I Used To Know’.
Hosted by film and music critic Megan Spencer, this event provided a fascinating insight into the collaborative journey, from initial concept and creative development, through to final clip production.

results.title: Fifty Years of Service
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson and State Electricity Commission of Victoria
results.brief_description: The first fifty years of the State Electricity Commission is presented by means of archival film detailing highlights of the development of the power authority for Victoria - from 1919 to the completion of the giant Hazelwood power complex.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shan Benson and State Electricity Commission of Victoria

results.title: ACMI Presents: A Life Exposed: Robyn Beeche

video_links.name: ACMI Presents: A Life Exposed: Robyn Beeche

results.brief_description: The 2013 documentary “A Life Exposed” (directed by Lesley Branagan) explores the life and work of Australian photographer Robyn Beeche. In this ACMI event, writer and former editor of Vogue Australia, Kirstie Clements, leads a discussion between Beeche and Branagan.
